entry.title: Re: How to configure and perform replenishment strategy i...
entry.content:
Dear Shubham,

Adding to the answer from my colleague Jerry, I´ve also tried to answer your questions. Please check as follows:

1. Am I missing any configuration steps in Public Cloud?

Those are the scope items regarding the Replenishment strategy. The test script of each scope items below is the step-by-step configuration and you can find the links as follows:

Test script - 4B3 : This is the scope item (step by step configuration) of the Replenishment Strategies for In-House Production (4B3), when you produce the kanban quantity yourself, to supply your own production. This is the one Jerry shared in his answer. 

Test script - 1E3 : This scope item 1E3 is regarding Material Replenishment with Kanban – External Procurement. Here, you obtain the kanban quantity using an order or a scheduling agreement from a supplier.

Test script - 4B4 : This one is the scope for Material Replenishment with Kanban – Stock Transfer, scope item 4B4.It is used when you transfer the kanban quantity to supply your own production.

2. Where I can find below configuration:

- Activate replenishment strategy for a storage type: In this blog from our community you can find instructions about Activate Replenishment Strategy:  SAP Community blog - Replenishment Strategies in SAP S/4Hana Cloud Warehouse Management 
And also you can find more information in the following link: - SAP Help Portal - Production Planning Control - Replenishment Strategies 

- Define replenishment sources: You also can check in the following documentation:  SAP Help Portal - Warehouse Management - Configuration for Replenishment Control 

- How can I Trigger or monitor replenishment in SAP Public Cloud: In the page 275 of the following document, you can find that exists a app called Warehouse Monitor in S/4hana Cloud Public edition: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 - Feature Scope Description 

3. Since I cannot find “Activate Replenishment Strategies in Storage Types” (which exists in On-Premise), is there an alternative way to achieve this in Public Cloud?
Please check item 2, the first link.

4. Could you share the detailed step-by-step process (with apps to be used) for setting up and testing replenishment in SAP Public Cloud?
Please check the item 1 with tests scripts with step by step instructions.

I hope with all these documents you can clear all your doubts.

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: Rentable Data Objects is missing in Migration Cockpit
entry.content:
As per the given information in the below Help Center portal:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/70747b45a7ab457b8eafbf4474a20d0c/031e5cfc08df4e5eb7d3c0163d40833c.html

Rentable object master records with usage category Rentable Object with Portfolio Structure (RP) must be provided by an external application using the SAP Master Data Integration service on SAP Business Technology Platform. You cannot create these master data records in the Manage Rentable Objects app, you can only display and edit them.

You can edit only the following master data for your rentable objects with the usage category Rentable Object with Portfolio Structure (RP); all other master data is display-only:

  • Authorization group (if this has been configured)

  • Usable object assignment
  • Measurement
  • Status
  • Contract assignment

entry.title: Re: Just Ask: Account dimension not detected on SAC Overv...
entry.content: @Harsh08 The issue arises because the Headcount Planning Model, despite using a public Account dimension, has not enabled the dimension's members for search indexing within this specific model context, as evidenced by the absence of member-level configuration options in the provided screenshot; this occurs even though the model itself is marked as "Ready" for indexing and "Enabled" for visibility, indicating a model-specific configuration oversight where the Account dimension's "Show in search" property remains disabled at the member level, thereby preventing synonym management—a conclusion confirmed by cross-referencing with functional models where this property is active and member synonyms are accessible.

entry.title: Re: Reporting on Correspondence portlet data in Recruitin...
entry.content: @rachelallen43 Yes, it is definitively possible to create a report that accurately reflects the correspondence data from the Recruiting Management candidate portlet, including the count of manual emails, their precise dispatch timestamps, and other communication metadata. This is achieved by leveraging the standard OData API, specifically the Candidate and Candidate_Background entities, where all system-triggered and user-initiated communications are logged with immutable audit trails; the emailStatus and emailStatusDate fields within these entities provide the exact send status and datetime stamps for each correspondence, ensuring the report's output is a verifiably correct and complete representation of the portlet's information.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Advanced Formula Logic for Copying L...
entry.content:
Dear @praveen_kumar334,

please keep in mind that our sample data might not always reflect the reality, the purpose of the sample data is to help you understanding the logic we offer within our content. And when you decide to remove all other dimensions, except Plant, Product, and Date, from both sides, it might happen that you copy unexpected data.

If you're 100% sure, that there is no incorrect data then you can remove the dimensions from both sides.
To us it seems reasonable to keep the dimensions on both sides to avoid unexpected data, that's why the advanced formula is delivered in this way.

Best regards
Susanne

entry.title: Discover Our New SAP Signavio Community Expert Sessions Page!
entry.content:
We're excited to announce a new home for all things SAP Signavio Community Expert Sessions—a page built for our growing community, reflecting your feedback and engagement over the past year.

A Year of Growth and Engagement

Since launching the Expert Sessions series in July 2024, our community has come together for 14 sessions, bringing practical insight and fresh perspectives to topics that matter. Behind these sessions, the numbers tell a story of active participation and genuine value:

  • Over 1,200 community registrants

  • 606 live attendees

  • 50% average conversion rate from registration to live participation

  • 174 social shares—spreading knowledge across networks

  • 4.4 out of 5 average session satisfaction

These milestones are a testament to your commitment to learning, sharing, and driving transformation, regardless of your role or experience level.

Why a Dedicated Page?

With this new Expert Sessions page, we're making it easier than ever to get involved:

  • On-demand library: Browse all past sessions, watch recordings, and download slides at your convenience.

  • Stay up to date: See what's coming next and register for upcoming sessions in just a few clicks.

  • FAQ and easy navigation: Find answers to common questions, learn how to participate, or suggest topics for future sessions.

  • Built for you: This page brings together everything you need, whether you're joining for the first time or catching up on sessions you missed.

What's Next?

This page is designed to be your go-to resource—a single starting point for exploring business process trends, learning from your peers, and staying connected to the SAP Signavio Community. It reflects what we can accomplish together and provides a foundation for what's ahead.

Whether you want to revisit a favorite session, explore specific topics in depth, or simply stay in the loop, we invite you to explore and share the new SAP Signavio Community Expert Sessions page.

Thank you for your ongoing participation, questions, and willingness to shape our community's future.

Let's continue to learn and drive change—together.

If you have feedback or ideas for future sessions, you're always welcome to reach out or add your suggestions directly on the page!

entry.title: Re: Using bgRFC for IDoc Inbound Processing
entry.content:
Just to clarify, the interface of function modules which are defined in WE85_INBOUND must be:

FUNCTION any_function_module_you_want
  IMPORTING
    control LIKE edidc
  EXPORTING
    VALUE(name) TYPE char32
  TABLES
    data LIKE edidd.
  """ code to return a QUEUE name in NAME
ENDFUNCTION.

IDOC_QUEUE_INB_CONST_ALE_QUEUE does:

NAME = 'ALE_QUEUE'.

IDOC_QUEUE_INB_MESTYP does:

NAME = CONTROL-MESTYP.

entry.title: Create Professional Service Projects via APIs
entry.content:
Business Requirement

We met a requirement from S/4HANA Public Cloud Customer. They'd like business process involves integrating from an OA system into S/4HANA Cloud to create a professional service project.

System Implementation

The professional service project is set up step by step using the standard API Overview | Commercial Project - Create, Update | SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

1. Configure Communication Arrangement
Communication arrangement Commercial Project Integration (SAP_COM_0054) is established.

2. POST Method - /ProjectSet: Create Customer Project

Payload Example:

{
  "ProjectCategory": "C",
  "OrgID": "1010",
  "CostCenter": "0010101902",
  "ProfitCenter": "YB101",
  "Customer": "10100002",
  "ProjectID": "CHEN0806",
  "ProjectStage": "P001",
  "Currency": "EUR",
  "StartDate": "2025-08-01T00:00:00",
  "EndDate": "2025-09-30T00:00:00",
  "ProjectName": "CHEN0806",
  "ProjectDesc": "CHEN0806",
  "ProjManagerExtId": "I532094",
  "ProjManagerCompCode": "1010",
  "RestrictTimePosting": "Y",
  "UseProjectBilling": "X",
  "Confidential": "N"
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: customer project CHEN0806 basic header information is successfully created.

3. POST Method - /WorkPackageSet: Create Project Work Package

Payload Example:

{
  "UnitId": "",
  "WorkPackageType": " ",
  "ProjectID": "CHEN0806",
  "Description": "CHEN0806",
  "WorkPackageID": "CHEN0806.1.3",
  "WorkPackageName": "Implementing",
  "WPStartDate": "2025-08-01T00:00:00",
  "WPEndDate": "2025-09-30T00:00:00"
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: project work package CHEN0806.1.3 has been successfully created.

4. POST Method - /WorkItemSet: Assign Work Item to Work Package

Payload Example:

{
  "ProjectID": "CHEN0806",
  "WorkPackageID": "CHEN0806.1.3",
  "WorkPackageName": "Implementing",
  "Workitem": "P002",
  "Workitemname": "Testing"
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: the work item Testing (P002) has been successfully assigned to work package CHEN0806.1.3.

5. POST Method - /A_EngmntProjRsceDmnd: Work Package Resource Demand Creation

Payload Example:

{
  "EngagementProject": "CHEN0806",
  "WorkPackage": "CHEN0806.1.3",
  "Version": "1",
  "ResourceDemand": "0010",
  "WorkItem": "P002",
  "BillingControlCategory": " ",
  "DeliveryOrganization": "1010",
  "EngagementProjectResourceType": "0ACT",
  "EngagementProjectResource": "T001",
  "PersonWorkAgreement": "50001538",
  "ResourceDemandStatus": "P",
  "Quantity": "10.000",
  "UnitOfMeasure": "H"
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: the primary consultant’s workload was allocated to the work package.

6. Change Project Stage to Contract Preparation, then POST Method - /A_CustProjSlsOrd: Create Project Billing Plan

Payload Example:

{
  "CustomerProject": "CHEN0806",
  "PurchaseOrderByCustomer": "API Customer reference",
  "CustomerPurchaseOrderDate": "2025-08-12T00:00:00",
  "PaymentMethod": "F",
  "to_CustProjSlsOrdItem": [
    {
      "SalesOrderItemCategory": "PS02",
      "Material": "P002",
      "ExpectedNetAmount": "1000",
      "TransactionCurrency": "EUR",
      "SalesOrderItem": "10",
      "SalesOrderItemText": "",
      "to_CustProjSlsOrdItemWorkPckg": [
        {
          "WorkPackage": "CHEN0806.1.3"
        }
      ],
      "to_CustProjSOIBillgPlnItm": [
        {
          "BillingPlanBillingDate": "2025-08-12T00:00:00",
          "BillingPlanItemUsage": ""
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: on the project billing tab, a contract of type Time & Expenses is successfully created.

entry.title: Re: Test Automation Software
entry.content: Since you’ll also be testing Salesforce, MES, and the integrations, it’s important to see how smoothly each tool can run end-to-end scenarios across different systems. It’s also worth examining SAP Cloud ALM integration closely, as support there is still evolving and can vary between vendors. A good approach is to narrow the list down to a couple of tools, run a pilot on real business processes, and compare how straightforward it is to create and maintain tests, as well as how the reporting and ALM integration hold up. In some cases, teams also bring in external expertise for guidance—partners experienced in custom software development, such as Idea Maker , can help design pilot approaches or streamline integration efforts. That usually provides much more useful insight than relying solely on vendor demos.

entry.title: How to Add Custom Tables for Local Extensions Calculation in SAP Variant Configuration & Pricing
entry.content:
SAP Variant Configuration & Pricing (VC&P) is a powerful tool for managing complex product configurations. Often, standard tables may not suffice for specific business logic, and you may need to introduce custom tables to support local extensions in pricing or configuration calculations.

This blog walks you through the steps to add a custom table and use it effectively in your local extensions logic.

Why Use Custom Tables?

Custom tables allow you to:

  • Store additional data not available in standard SAP tables.
  • Implement business-specific logic.
  • Enhance flexibility in pricing or configuration rules.

Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Create the Custom Table in SAP

Use transaction SE11 to create a transparent table.

  • Define fields relevant to your logic (e.g., product ID, region, surcharge).
  • Set appropriate data types and key fields.
  • Activate the table.

Step 2: Populate the Table

Use SM30 or a custom program to maintain entries in your table.

Step 3: Create a Function Module or ABAP Class

This will serve as the interface between your custom table and the VC&P logic.

  • Use SE37 or SE24.
  • Read data from your custom table based on input parameters.
  • Return the required value (e.g., surcharge, discount).

Step 4: Register the Function Module in VC&P

In the VC&P environment 

  • Go to the Local Extensions section.
  • Upload your javascript file in uploaded zip file and Register your function module or class.
  • Mapped input/output parameters.
  • Active Local Extensions - you will see the Function Name which will be active 

Step 5: Use the Custom Table in Calculation Logic

Now you can use your custom logic in:

  • Pricing procedures
  • Configuration rules
  • Condition records

Step 6: Add the Custom Tables 

Step 1 - Click on Tables from left menu - 2nd Tab - Custom tables

Step 2 - (Important Disclaimer and must to read) and Click Next

Step 3 - Add the custom tables in table list row by row and Click Submit and Select checkbox - Next Step

Step 4 - Custom table added will process and trigger to update the records into tables - you will see Running Queue starts

Example Use Case

Imagine you want to apply a regional surcharge based on the product and customer location. Your custom table might look like:

Product ID Region Surcharge (%)
P1001EU5
P1001US7
Your function module reads this table and returns the surcharge to be applied in the pricing logic.

Best Practices

  • Use naming conventions for custom objects.
  • Document your logic clearly.
  • Test thoroughly in a sandbox before moving to production.

entry.title: How to set an unique number range that includes all alphanumeric values, from 01 to ZZZZZZ?
entry.content:
How to set an unique number range that includes all alphanumeric values, from 01 to ZZZZZZ, without resulting in overlapping issues (Error: "Interval & overlaps with interval &")

We want to use only one external number range that includes material numbers such as, for example, 00123 and ABC123 in the same number range.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to set an unique number range that includes all a...
entry.content:
Consider setting up a single number range that starts from 1 and goes up to ZZZZZZZZ in SSCUI/Configuration Activity 102282 Define Number Ranges for Each Material Type.
This ensures that the material number range have a wide range to cover all the numbers you might need.

To solve overlapping issues, consider adjusting each other/additional number range as follows: set them as external number range from ZZZZZZZZZ\01 to ZZZZZZZZZ\02, ZZZZZZZZZ\03 to ZZZZZZZZZ\04, and so on.
Changing the number ranges from internal to external may cause errors when creating materials which the material type used the internal number range that was changed.
To solve this issue please remove all internal number ranges that has been changed to external in SSCUI/Configuration Activity 100306 Define Attributes for Material Types

This approach eliminates any potential overlapping issues.

If you need automatic material number creation (the system generating material number automatically) consider maintaining at least one internal number range, by doing the following, as example:

  1. Setting the number range 01 to internal with 000000001 to 000010000
  2. Setting the number range 02 to external with 000010001 to ZZZZZZZZ
  3. Setting other number ranges as external with ZZZZZZZZZ\01 to ZZZZZZZZZ\02, ZZZZZZZZZ\03 to ZZZZZZZZZ\04, and so on.

It is also possible to check the flag "External no. assignment w/o check" in the material type for that specific material type to accept any value as external number, even if it is outside of the assigned external number range.
This way the material can be created with all alphanumeric values without changing the number ranges.

More information on number ranges related to product master are available in the following blog post:

  • How does number ranges works in Product Master SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? | SAP Community

If it is needed to include material numbers with the - character, as it has a lower value than numbers, it is possible to set one external number range with 1----- to ZZZZZ, with the counterpoint of not being possible to maintain an internal number range (which is purely numeric number ranges, and all purely numeric material numbers are within the bounds of 1----- to ZZZZZ).

Kind Regards,
Ícaro
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Using bgRFC for IDoc Inbound Processing
entry.content:
If you are an ABAP developer and you are interested to get deeper, the starting point of IDoc bgRFC is located in the function module IDOC_INBOUND_ASYNCHRONOUS (*), and specifically in the called subroutines IDOCS_PROCESS > ONE_IDOC_PACKET_PROCESS > PACKET_PROCESS_BGRFC. The latter subroutine contains all the logic concerning the priority groups, priorities, queues, WE85_INBOUND function modules and so on.

(*) The function module IDOC_INBOUND_ASYNCHRONOUS is triggered when an outbound IDoc is written, if the target port is of type RFC.

entry.title: Re: Calculation of 'Best Possible' DSO
entry.content:
Hello @12345678901 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Question 1: Difference between actual DSO and Best Possible DSO is visualised in the table below.

Actual DSO

Best Possible DSO 

·         measures the average number of days it takes for an organisation to collect its payments on invoices.

·         Includes both current and overdue receivables.

·         reflects real collection experience including payment delays or late payments.

 

·         represents the ideal or best-case scenario assuming all customers pay on time

·         Considers only current and not overdue receivables.

·         Reflects the shortest possible collection timeframe if payment terms were strictly followed

 

 

 

Question 2: Is Best Possible DSO calculated the same way as Actual DSO?

Actual DSO

Best Possible DSO 

·         Both use similar formular involving receivables, credit sales and days in the period but differ in which receivables are considered.

  • Uses the formular: (Total receivables at period end * Number of days) / Total credit sales during the period

 

·         Uses the formular: (Current receivables * Number of days) / Total credit sales during the period, ignoring past due invoices.

·         Hence, generally lower, indicates the minimum of expected days outstanding if payments were prompt.

 

For further details consult the  Days Sales Outstanding and the Days Sales Outstanding Calculation for a Specific Period.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Updating or Modifying Payroll Results (Cluster Tables) in a Concurrent Employment Scenario
entry.content:
Why do we need to?

There are scenarios where payroll has already been executed, and subsequent activities such as posting to finance, bank transfers, or reporting have been carried out. Later, it may be discovered that certain employee-specific configurations were incorrect at the time of execution.

Although corrections may have been made in the configuration, the payroll engine may not reflect these updates. In some cases, it may even throw errors because the payroll results stored in the system do not align with the corrected configuration.

This creates a challenging situation:

  • We cannot simply delete the payroll results for an employee, as downstream processes (such as postings and payments) have already taken place.

  • At the same time, we cannot proceed with future payroll runs, as the inconsistency between payroll results and updated configuration prevents smooth processing.

In such cases, the ability to overwrite, modify, or update payroll results becomes essential. This approach provides a controlled way to align payroll results with corrected data, ensuring both system integrity and continuity of payroll operations.

How is it done?

  1. Validate Pernr by checking if the Person assignment is there or not.
  2. For the given Pernr, read the payroll cluster directory
  3. Check if the payroll results are available for the given sequence number
  4. Create a reference access object to payroll results
  5. Get all active Pernrs (Employments) for the period being processed
  6. Update payroll results for all Pernr assignments

Program (Code) - To Update the Tax Company Code for the US in Payroll clusters/results when Concurrent Employment is Active/Enabled

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report  ZHR_TAX_COMP_UPDATE_US_CE
*&
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&
*&
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT zhr_tax_comp_update_us_ce NO STANDARD PAGE HEADING.

*& Data type declaration
TYPES:
  BEGIN OF ts_log,
    person   TYPE pc261-person,
    persdata TYPE pc261-persdata,
    seqnr    TYPE pc261-seqnr,
    abkrs    TYPE pc261-abkrs,
    fpper    TYPE pc261-fpper,
    inper    TYPE pc261-inper,
    payty    TYPE pc261-payty,
    paydt    TYPE pc261-paydt,
    status   TYPE char4,
    descr    TYPE char120,
  END OF ts_log.

*& Data declaration
DATA:
  lt_rgdir                  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF pc261,
  ls_rgdir                  TYPE pc261,
  ls_rgdir1                 TYPE pc261,
  lv_relid                  TYPE relid_pcl,
  lv_molga                  TYPE molga,
  lt_result                 TYPE h99_hr_pay_result_tab,
  lv_pernr                  TYPE pcce_pernr,
  lv_update                 TYPE boolean,
  lo_access                 TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_access,
  lo_person_result          TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_person,
  lo_payroll_result_us      TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_person_us,
  lo_pr_peras_international TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result,
  lo_pr_peras               TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_us,
  lo_person                 TYPE REF TO cl_hrcce_person_reader,
  ls_log                    TYPE ts_log,
  lt_log                    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ts_log,
  lt_fieldcat               TYPE slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
  ls_fieldcat               TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
  ls_layout                 TYPE slis_layout_alv,
  lv_person                 TYPE personid,
  lt_assignments            TYPE pccet_pernr_unsorted.

*& Field symbol declaration
FIELD-SYMBOLS:
  <fs_grouping>   TYPE pc2grouping,
  <fs_rt_person>  TYPE pc2rt_person,
  <fs_crt_person> TYPE pc2crt_person,
  <fs_bt_person>  TYPE pc2bt_person,
  <fs_tax>        TYPE pc22t,
  <fs_tcrt>       TYPE pc23h.

*& Selection screen
SELECTION-SCREEN: BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE text-001.
PARAMETERS:
  p_pernr TYPE p_pernr MATCHCODE OBJECT prem OBLIGATORY,
  s_txcmp TYPE t5utl-txcmp OBLIGATORY,
  t_txcmp TYPE t5utl-txcmp OBLIGATORY,
  p_seqnr TYPE pc261-seqnr OBLIGATORY,
  p_test  AS   CHECKBOX.
SELECTION-SCREEN: END OF BLOCK b1.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON p_pernr.
*& Validate Pernr by getting Person and all the Pernrs for the given Pernr
  FREE lo_person.
  lo_person = cl_hrcce_person_reader=>get_instance( ).
  IF lo_person IS BOUND.
    TRY.
*& Check Person assignment
        CALL METHOD lo_person->get_personid
          EXPORTING
            p_pernr    = p_pernr
          RECEIVING
            p_personid = lv_person.
      CATCH cx_hrpa_violated_assertion .
        MESSAGE 'Person assignment is missing for the given pernr' TYPE 'E'.
    ENDTRY.                            " TRY.
  ENDIF.                               " IF lo_person IS BOUND.

START-OF-SELECTION.
*& Read payroll cluster directory
  REFRESH lt_rgdir.
  CALL FUNCTION 'CU_READ_RGDIR'
    EXPORTING
      persnr          = p_pernr
    TABLES
      in_rgdir        = lt_rgdir
    EXCEPTIONS
      no_record_found = 1
      OTHERS          = 2.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
          WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ELSEIF lt_rgdir IS INITIAL.
    CLEAR ls_log.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
    CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr' p_pernr
           INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
    ls_log-person = lv_person.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
  ENDIF.                               " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Check if the payroll results available for given sequence number
  READ TABLE lt_rgdir INTO ls_rgdir1 WITH KEY seqnr = p_seqnr.
  IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
*& Access to payroll results
    FREE lo_access.
    CREATE OBJECT lo_access.
*& Get all Pernrs
    CALL METHOD lo_access->get_participating_pernrs
      EXPORTING
        molga            = lv_molga
        pernr            = p_pernr
        period           = ls_rgdir1
      IMPORTING
        pernr_tab        = lt_assignments
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_entries_found = 1
        OTHERS           = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
    ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  ELSE.
    CLEAR ls_log.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
    CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr' p_pernr
                'Sequence number' p_seqnr INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
    ls_log-person = lv_person.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
  ENDIF.                               " IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
*& Update payroll results for all Pernr assignments
  CLEAR lv_pernr.
  LOOP AT lt_assignments INTO lv_pernr.
*& Read payroll cluster directory
    REFRESH lt_rgdir.
    CALL FUNCTION 'CU_READ_RGDIR'
      EXPORTING
        persnr          = lv_pernr
      TABLES
        in_rgdir        = lt_rgdir
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_record_found = 1
        OTHERS          = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
*& Check if RGDIR is empty
    ELSEIF lt_rgdir IS INITIAL.
      CLEAR ls_log.
      ls_log-persdata = lv_pernr.
      ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
      CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr'
                  lv_pernr INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
      ls_log-person = lv_person.
      ls_log-persdata = lv_pernr.
      APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
    ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Access to payroll results
    FREE lo_access.
    CREATE OBJECT lo_access.
*& Read payroll cluster
    LOOP AT lt_rgdir INTO ls_rgdir WHERE abkrs EQ ls_rgdir1-abkrs
                                     AND inper EQ ls_rgdir1-inper.
*& Read payroll cluster id
      CLEAR: lv_relid, lv_molga.
      CALL FUNCTION 'PYXX_GET_RELID_FROM_PERNR'
        EXPORTING
          employee                    = lv_pernr
        IMPORTING
          relid                       = lv_relid
          molga                       = lv_molga
        EXCEPTIONS
          error_reading_infotype_0001 = 1
          error_reading_molga         = 2
          error_reading_relid         = 3
          OTHERS                      = 4.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
              WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
      ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Read payroll results for Person and Pernr
      IF lo_access IS BOUND.
        FREE lo_person_result.
        REFRESH  lt_result.
        CALL METHOD lo_access->read_result
          EXPORTING
            pernr                         = lv_pernr
            molga                         = lv_molga
            period                        = ls_rgdir
          IMPORTING
            pay_result_person             = lo_person_result
            pay_results                   = lt_result
          EXCEPTIONS
            no_authorization              = 1
            read_error                    = 2
            country_version_not_available = 3
            OTHERS                        = 4.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
                  WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
        ENDIF.                         " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Get Person payroll results
        FREE lo_payroll_result_us.
        IF lo_person_result IS BOUND.
          lo_payroll_result_us ?= lo_person_result.
        ENDIF.                         " IF lo_person_result IS BOUND.
*& Update Tax Company in Person payroll results
        IF lo_payroll_result_us IS BOUND.
*& Update the RT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_rt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-rt_person ASSIGNING <fs_rt_person>.
            IF <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-rt_person...
*& Update the CRT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_crt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-crt_person ASSIGNING <fs_crt_person>.
            IF <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-crt_person...
*& Update the BT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_bt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-bt_person ASSIGNING <fs_bt_person>.
            IF <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-bt_person...
*& Update the GROUPING cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_grouping>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-grouping ASSIGNING <fs_grouping> .
            IF <fs_grouping>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_grouping>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_grouping>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-grouping...
*            ls_result-EVP = o_payroll_result_us->
*& Get Pernr details
          FREE lo_pr_peras.
          LOOP AT lt_result INTO lo_pr_peras_international.
            IF lo_pr_peras_international IS NOT INITIAL.
              lo_pr_peras ?= lo_pr_peras_international.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras_international IS NOT INITIAL.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lt_result...
*& Update Tax Company in Pernr payroll results
          IF lo_pr_peras IS BOUND.
*& Update the TAX cluster with correct tax company code
            UNASSIGN <fs_tax>.
            LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tax ASSIGNING <fs_tax>.
              IF <fs_tax>-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
                <fs_tax>-tccpm = t_txcmp.
                lv_update = abap_true.
              ENDIF.                   " IF <fs_tax>-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
            ENDLOOP.                   " LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tax
*& Update the TCRT cluster with correct tax company code
            UNASSIGN <fs_tcrt>.
            LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tcrt ASSIGNING <fs_tcrt>.
              IF <fs_tcrt>-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
                <fs_tcrt>-txcmp = t_txcmp.
                lv_update = abap_true.
              ENDIF.                   " IF <fs_tcrt>-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
            ENDLOOP.                   " LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tcrt...
*& Update the PERM cluster with correct tax company code
            IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
              lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm
            IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
              lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp...
          ENDIF.                       " IF lo_pr_peras IS BOUND.
*& Check if Tax Company to be updated to the DB
          IF lv_update EQ abap_true.
            IF p_test EQ abap_false.
*& Refresh buffer
              CALL METHOD lo_access->reset_buffer.
*& Write the changes to buffer
              CALL METHOD lo_access->write_result
                EXPORTING
                  pay_result_person = lo_person_result
                  pay_results       = lt_result
*                 SIM_NON_CE_RESULT = ' '
                EXCEPTIONS
                  no_authorization  = 1
                  write_error       = 2
                  inconsistent_data = 3
                  OTHERS            = 4.
              IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
              ENDIF.                     " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Push the chnages from buffer to the DB
              CALL METHOD lo_access->write_to_database
                EXCEPTIONS
                  no_authorization = 1
                  write_error      = 2
                  OTHERS           = 3.
              IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
              ELSE.
                COMMIT WORK.
                CLEAR ls_log.
                MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
                ls_log-status = icon_green_light.
                CONCATENATE 'Payroll results were updated from Tax Company' s_txcmp 'to'
                t_txcmp 'for Pernr' lv_pernr 'Perosn' lo_person_result->person
                INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
                APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
              ENDIF.                     " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
            ELSE.
              MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
              ls_log-status = icon_green_light.
              CONCATENATE 'Payroll results were updated from Tax Company' s_txcmp 'to'
              t_txcmp 'for Pernr' lv_pernr 'Perosn' lo_person_result->person
              INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
              APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
            ENDIF.                   " IF P_test EQ abap_false.
          ELSE.
            CLEAR ls_log.
            MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
            ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
            CONCATENATE 'Source Tax Company ' s_txcmp 'does not exists for Pernr '
                        lv_pernr 'Perosn ' lo_person_result->person INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
            APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
          ENDIF.                       " IF lv_update EQ abap_true.
        ENDIF.                         " IF lo_payroll_result_us IS BOUND.
      ENDIF.                           " IF lo_access IS BOUND.
    ENDLOOP.                           " LOOP AT lt_rgdir
  ENDLOOP.                             " LOOP AT lt_assignments...

END-OF-SELECTION.
*& Build field catalog to display log
  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PERSON'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PERSON'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PERSDATA'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PERSDATA'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'SEQNR'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'SEQNR'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'ABKRS'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'ABKRS'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'FPPER'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'FPPER'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'INPER'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'INPER'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PAYTY'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PAYTY'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PAYDT'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PAYDT'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'STATUS'.
  ls_fieldcat-seltext_m = 'Status'.
  ls_fieldcat-icon = abap_true.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'DESCR'.
  ls_fieldcat-seltext_m = 'Details'.
  ls_fieldcat-outputlen = 120.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

*& Build alv layout
  ls_layout-colwidth_optimize = abap_true.
  ls_layout-zebra = abap_true.

*& Display log
  CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
    EXPORTING
      i_grid_title  = 'US_CE : Tax Company update in Payoll Results ( PCL2 )'
      is_layout     = ls_layout
      it_fieldcat   = lt_fieldcat
    TABLES
      t_outtab      = lt_log
    EXCEPTIONS
      program_error = 1
      OTHERS        = 2.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ENDIF.

entry.title: Re: Hide/display fields depending of active/draft status...
entry.content:
this is the code from sap, hope you can get some idea.

original_table is it_original_data from if_sadl_exit_calc_element_read~calculate

METHOD is_DRAFT.

" we assume that framework queries virtual elements for draft or active. not both at same time.

" so we just look at first entry

DATA(lv_draft_exists) = abap_false.

" FIELD-SYMBOLS: <original_tab> TYPE INDEX TABLE.

 

READ TABLE original_table ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<first>) INDEX 1.

IF <first> IS NOT ASSIGNED.

RAISE EXCEPTION NEW cx_invalid_argument( ).

ENDIF.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'ISACTIVEENTITY' OF STRUCTURE <first> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_data>).

 

IF <fs_data> IS ASSIGNED.

lv_draft_exists = xsdbool( <fs_data> = abap_false ).

ENDIF.

 

r_is_draft = COND #( WHEN lv_draft_exists = abap_true

THEN if_abap_behv=>mk-on

ELSE if_abap_behv=>mk-off ).

ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Using the SAP EarlyWatch Alert Status App
entry.content:
SAP Note 1257308 - FAQ: Using EarlyWatch Alert provides preliminary information about the Status App. The app tracks the status of the SAP EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) from the arrival of service data through all processing steps at SAP. This app is intended for administrators to troubleshoot the EWA process. This blog will provide a more detailed description of the Status App functionality.

EWA session data can be sent to SAP through various methods. The EWA session data can be sent directly to SAP through the HTTP destination SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL (via SAP-SUPPORT_PARCELBOX) from either an ABAP managed system or an SAP Solution Manager system. Additionally, any EWA session data for systems managed by the ECS team are sent via their SAP Focused Run systems on SAP side to be processed. The following Notes and KBAs are provided for more information on all three scenarios.

  • 207223 - SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP
  • 1684537 - EarlyWatch Alert Not Sent to SAP: Troubleshooting Guide - SAP Solution Manager
  • 2930644 - SAP Focused Run: EarlyWatch Alert Troubleshooting Guide - Guided Answer

After sending EWA session data through one of the available methods it can be unclear whether the EWA data was successfully received by SAP or if there was any issue with the EWA session processing. The EWA Status App allows you to follow the status of your EWA report once it’s sent to SAP.

All EWA session data sent to SAP will be available for review in the EWA Status App, here you will find various details about the EWA sessions you have sent.

You can see the date the EWA session data session was sent, if they have been successfully received by SAP, as well as whether the EWA session could be processed successful or has been generated and posted in the EWA workspace.

Since the EWA session data packages sent to SAP are processed in randomly assigned batches for all customers it can take from a few hours to a few days for your EWA result to be available in various SAP applications like the EWA Workspace, Solution Finder, EWA Dashboard, or as a Word document available for download. Using the Status App allows you to track this process without opening a case.

The general fields available in the EWA Status App that are applicable for all system types are the following columns.

  • System
  • Product
  • Sending System Product
  • Data Received at SAP
  • Collected At

The “System” and “Product” columns will list the long and short SID as well as the product version respectively of the EWA target system.

The “Sending System Product” column, however, will display the product version of the system that transferred the session data to SAP. This is most often a Solution Manager or Focused Run system.  

Finally, the “Data Received at SAP” and “Collected at” columns document the date and time the EWA session package was received by SAP as well as when it was collected on the managed system.

Data Transfer Status Details

In the EWA Status App the “Data Transfer Status Details” column can have one of three status’. The status’ are Rejected, Ignored, Success. As you would expect Success simply indicates the EWA session data was successfully transferred to SAP. The other two status’ can be indicative of various errors. I will describe the most common in more detail below.

"Ignored (duplicate)"

This status indicates that the EWA is sent multiple times per week for the same system. You should check to see if the EWA is being sent from both Solution Manager and the managed system. The same checks should be performed for on prem FRUN systems. The EWA could also be sent multiple times per week from the same system. All will result in the same status.

"Ignored (not in allow list)"

This status can be caused by a few errors. However, the most common would be that either the license or maintenance certificate for the system is expired.

Recommendation:

Review the SLICENSE transaction in Solution Manager if used as well as the managed system to ensure both are up to date.

"Rejected (system time in future)"

The system runs with a system time deviating from official time. 

Recommendation:

The System Time can be synced manually by your system Admin. However, it is likely that this is a temporary change for testing purposes and it will sync automatically via Internet. If not working, your Admin can start this sync process at the OS Level.

 

"Rejected (no data)"

The service data that arrived at SAP is either not readable or empty or incomplete and thus important parts are completely missing.

Recommendation:

This would indicate that there are issues with EWA session data collection or service data quality. We recommend reviewing the resolution steps in the KBA 1824881 - Summary of Grey Rated EWA Reports - SAP Solution Manager.

"Rejected (non-productive)"

Only for productive and test systems the EWA is processed at SAP. Based on the system role the service data can be rejected. This is true for managed systems before ST-PI 740 SP23 (ST-PI 2008_1_7xx SP33) more information on the adjusted criteria can be found in SAP Note 207223 - SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP.

"Rejected (not authorized)"

The technical communication user used for upload is not authorized to upload for this system.

Or

The technical communication user used for upload is not valid anymore.

Or

The user used for upload is not a technical communication user.

Recommendation:

You will need to ensure the S user assigned to both the SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL and SAP-SUPPORT_PACELBOX HTTP destinations is a valid technical user. The following KBA outlines the requirements for the assigned user.

2174416 - Creation and activation of Technical Communication Users - SAP for Me

"Rejected (other reason)"

Create a case with component SV-SCS-EWA-GEN.

"Rejected (content size exceeds limit)"

The service data exceeds the size limit.

"Rejected (unknown system type)"

Supported technical system types are ABAP, HANA, JAVA and BOBJ. When extracting the leading system from the service data either no technical system type was determined, or the technical system type is not supported by EarlyWatch Alert.

Recommendation:

If using Solution Manager it is recommended that you review the system information maintained in LMDB. Ensure the technical system type is maintained and that it is a supported type.

In addition, in some scenarios is may be required to replace the SDCCN service definitions. The following KBA outlines the process and under which circumstances these steps should be performed.

SAP KBA 1765141 - When should the Service Definitions be completely replaced (Delete and Download) using the steps outlined in SAP Note 727998?

"Rejected (data too old)"

The service data that was sent to SAP was collected more than 112 days ago. Such old service data is not processed by SAP.

 

Details on Report Status, Dashboard Status, and Solution Finder Status

These three columns are relatively binary. The Status can either be “Success” or “Missing” / blank. In rare instances you can receive the status “Error (Initialization Failed)”. In this instance a case should be opened in the SV-SMG-SER-EWA component area.

The Report Status will be successful when the EWA document has been successfully generated. Until this point this column will remain blank. As mentioned previously it can take from a few hours to several days for your EWA result to be available. If the EWA session data was successfully received by SAP there is no cause for concern if the EWA report is not immediately available.

The same is true of the columns “Dashboard Status” and “Solution Finder Status”. When these applications are fully populated the EWA column status here in the Status App will change to Success. Prior to this the status will remain either blank or have the status “Missing”. Neither status is a cause for concern. If after several days the status of these columns remains unpopulated you should open a case in the SV-SMG-SER-EWA component area.

 

2 Billion Record Limit Status and Number Range Forecast Details

This column is system dependent. These checks are in reference to the maximum table size for HANA systems. The maximum table size cannot exceed 2 billion records for a HANA system without detrimental impact to the system.

However, the status “Missing” is most often applied to systems that do not have a HANA component. This information is not relevant to your system if you do not have a HANA Component and is not a cause for concern. You should review the EWA for the affected system to confirm that there is no associated HANA DB.

For HANA systems where this check was not successfully performed the status will instead be “No Forecast”, “Partial Success”, or “Unconfident Forecast”.

These may be a cause for concern and your first steps should be to review the RTCCTOOL recommendations of both the managed system and Solution Manager. You are looking for any red warning objects related to HANA session data, ST-PI, or ST-A/PI.

More information about the exact limitations of HANA are documented in the KBA 2154870 - How-To: Understanding and defining SAP HANA Limitations.

Additionally, more information can be found in the HANA Sizing Blog.

entry.title: 🟠 CAPuccino
entry.content:
CAPuccino is a native application designed to make deploying and monitoring CAP applications on the BTP as smooth as your morning coffee. Built with the grow-as-you-go philosophy of CAP in mind, CAPuccino simplifies the initial deployment process and offers powerful monitoring features all from a locally running app. This approach allows CAP developers to focus on their problem domains instead of wrestling with infrastructure.
For monitoring features, we draw inspiration from the CAP Developer Dashboard as well as integrating elements from OpenLens. Our goal is to create a tool that developers, including ourselves, would truly enjoy using.

entry.title: Distribute the differential amount during true up month for BBP Customer
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We're currently working on a solution where the requirement is to distribute the differential amount (+/-) equally into the next payment plan.

Scenario Details:

1. Current BBP : $ 109

2. Differential Amount during true up month: $49

3. System proposed New BBP amount based on the last 12 month history : $101

4. New BBP amount as per business requirement: $ 101 + (49/12) = $ 105. Essentially no differential amount neither should be settled on a true up month nor carried forward to the next payment plan. Instead, distribute that differential amount into the next payment plan to ensure customer/utility retailer do no owe anything.

Any suggested solution.

Thanks,

S

entry.title: Building a CMIS 1.1 Compliant Document Management Solution on SAP BTP
entry.content:
SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) offers a Document Management Service (DMS) that is fully compliant with the CMIS 1.1 standard. This compliance ensures interoperability with various enterprise applications, providing a standardized way to manage, store, and retrieve content.

At SAT Infotech, we wanted to push this concept further by creating an equally compliant alternative architecture using open-source technologies, while still leveraging the scalability and cloud-native capabilities of SAP BTP. Our solution combines Apache Chemistry, PostgreSQL, and the SAP BTP Object Store to provide a flexible and standards-based document management layer.

Why CMIS 1.1 Compliance Matters

CMIS (Content Management Interoperability Services) 1.1 defines a uniform standard for content repositories. This reduces vendor lock-in and makes it easier to integrate document workflows across platforms and applications such as ERP, CRM, and custom business applications. By following this standard, enterprises gain:

  • Easier application integration
  • Reduced custom development effort
  • Increased flexibility in document-centric processes
  • Portability of data across systems

Our Architecture Approach

We designed our CMIS 1.1 compliant document management service using the following components:

  • Apache Chemistry (OpenCMIS): Provides the open-source CMIS implementation. We extended and modernized Apache Chemistry to be compliant with the latest Jakarta EE specifications, ensuring long-term support for enterprise usage.
  • PostgreSQL: Stores and manages the metadata for documents, folders, and relationships. By choosing PostgreSQL, we ensured flexibility, scalability, and adherence to enterprise-grade transaction safety.
  • SAP BTP Object Store: Handles the actual binary content (documents, media files, etc.). This allows us to separate metadata management from content storage, achieving optimal performance while leveraging BTP’s native storage capabilities.

Achievements with Apache Chemistry and Jakarta EE

Our contribution involved working extensively with Apache Chemistry to bring it up to date with Jakarta EE standards. This was a critical step because it ensures compatibility with the evolving Java ecosystem that SAP BTP supports. The improvements included:

  • Migrating dependencies from older Java EE packages to Jakarta namespaces.
  • Ensuring CMIS 1.1 features such as secondary object types, bulk update operations, and improved ACL handling are fully functional.
  • Testing interoperability with multiple CMIS clients and tools.

Deep Dive: Architecture and Apache Chemistry Modernization for SAP BTP

The architecture revolves around providing a fully CMIS 1.1-compliant repository while leveraging SAP BTP services. A key challenge was modernizing Apache Chemistry (OpenCMIS), which originally relied on older Java EE APIs incompatible with SAP Java Build Pack 2, requiring migration to the Jakarta EE 9+ namespace (javax.* to jakarta.*).

Key Modernization Steps

  1. Jakarta Namespace Migration: Refactoring imports and dependencies to Jakarta EE packages for SAP BTP compatibility.
  2. Dependency Upgrades: Updating JAXB, Servlet API, and parsers to modern, cloud-ready versions.
  3. Modularization & Containerization: Separating CMIS API handling from metadata and content layers for independent scaling.
  4. Asynchronous Patterns: Incorporating reactive APIs to enhance scalability within SAP Cloud Foundry.
  5. Security Integration: Extending authentication to leverage SAP BTP OAuth 2.0 and XSUAA services.
  6. Robust Testing: Ensuring CMIS 1.1 feature compliance and cross-client interoperability.

Architecture Diagram

+----------------------+     +----------------------+      +-----------------------+
|  CMIS API Interface  |<--->|  Apache Chemistry    |<---> | PostgreSQL Metadata DB |
|  (REST + SOAP)       |     |  (modernized server) |      |  (transactional store)|
+----------------------+     +----------------------+      +-----------------------+
                                   |
                                   |
                                   V
                         +------------------------+
                         |  SAP BTP Object Store   |
                         | (document content blobs)|
                         +------------------------+

Commercial Benefits and Pricing Comparison

SAP BTP Document Management Service (DMS) offers:

  • 235 EUR per 100GB storage/month
  • Minimum 96 EUR API call charges for 4 blocks (50,000 calls per block)

Starting at ~331 EUR/month for 100GB with minimum API usage.

SAT Infotech’s modular solution on SAP BTP utilizes:

  • Cloud Foundry Runtime: 85 EUR/month for 1GB memory (scales with usage)
  • PostgreSQL Hyperscaler Option: 70 EUR/month for 2GB memory + 6.5 EUR/month per 5GB metadata storage
  • SAP BTP Object Store: 12 EUR per 100GB storage/month

 

Storage (GB)SAP BTP DMS (EUR/month) SAT Infotech Runtime + PostgreSQL (EUR/month)  SAT Infotech Object Store (EUR/month)SAT Infotech Total (EUR/month)
100331161.512173.5
5001,271161.560221.5
1,0002,446247.75120367.75
2,0004,796247.75240487.75
5,00011,846247.75600847.75
10,00023,596247.751,2001,447.75

*Note: Runtime and PostgreSQL memory/storage increase from 1,000GB+ scale.*

Cost Savings Analysis

  

Storage (GB)Monthly Savings (EUR)Yearly Savings (EUR)
100157.51,890
5001,049.512,594
1,0002,078.2524,939
2,0004,308.2551,699
5,00011,000.25132,003
10,00022,148.25265,779
 

 

Pricing References

  • PostgreSQL Hyperscaler Option
  • Cloud Foundry Runtime
  • SAP BTP Object Store
  • SAP Document Management Service Integration Option

This comprehensive article provides deep insights into our approach to building an extensible, cloud-native CMIS compliant document management solution on SAP BTP — delivering architectural robustness and compelling cost savings.
